DataElement.preferredDefinition: The time of skin response measurements represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Skin Response Domain Skin Response Test Code Measurement Time

ReferenceDocuments.name: What was the time of the skin
ReferenceDocuments.description: What was the time of the skin response measurement?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Case Report Form
ReferenceDocuments.description: Record time of measurement (as complete as possible).

ReferenceDocuments.name: SRDTC
ReferenceDocuments.description: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable SRDTC using the ISO 8601 format.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDASH Implementation Notes
ReferenceDocuments.description: A single time can be collected for all the measurements when they are performed at the same time. The time of each measurement can also be collected using a CDASH variable [SRTESTCD]_SRTIM. Planned time point are needed to differentiate multiple sequential assessments. It is recommended that time points should be pre-printed on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as Planned Time Point can be included as the column header.
